name: USCoreConditionEncounterDiagnosisProfile
title: US Core Condition Encounter Diagnosis Profile
description: The US Core Condition Encounter Diagnosis Profile is based upon the core FHIR Condition Resource and meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 *Encounter Diagnosis* requirements. In version 5.0.0, The US Core Condition Profile has been split into the US Core Condition Encounter Diagnosis Profile and US Core Condition Problems and Health Concerns Profile. To promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation, this profile defines constraints and extensions on the Condition resource for the minimal set of data to record, search, and fetch information about an encounter diagnosis.  It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present in the resource and constrains the way the elements are used when using this profile. It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: An Extension

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: extension
elements.short: (USCDI) Date the condition was first asserted
elements.description: The date on which the existence of the Condition was first asserted or acknowledged.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Business identifiers assigned to this condition by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: clinicalStatus
elements.short: (USCDI) active | recurrence | relapse | inactive | remission | resolved
elements.description: The clinical status of the condition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: verificationStatus
elements.short: (USCDI) unconfirmed | provisional | differential | confirmed | refuted | entered-in-error
elements.description: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: category
elements.description: A category assigned to the condition.

binding.description: A category assigned to the condition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: 'problem' if from PRB-3. 'diagnosis' if from DG1 segment in PV1 message

elements.name: category
elements.description: A category assigned to the condition.

binding.description: A category assigned to the condition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: 'problem' if from PRB-3. 'diagnosis' if from DG1 segment in PV1 message

elements.name: severity
elements.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

binding.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Can be pre/post-coordinated into value.  Or ./inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="severity"].value

elements.name: code
elements.short: (USCDI) Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis
elements.description: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

binding.description: Valueset to describe the actual problem experienced by the patient

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map:
code 246090004 |Associated finding| (< 404684003 |Clinical finding| MINUS
<< 420134006 |Propensity to adverse reactions| MINUS 
<< 473010000 |Hypersensitivity condition| MINUS 
<< 79899007 |Drug interaction| MINUS
<< 69449002 |Drug action| MINUS 
<< 441742003 |Evaluation finding| MINUS 
<< 307824009 |Administrative status| MINUS 
<< 385356007 |Tumor stage finding|) 
OR < 413350009 |Finding with explicit context|
OR < 272379006 |Event|

elements.name: bodySite
elements.description: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: subject
elements.description: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: encounter
elements.description: The Encounter during which this Condition was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: onset[x]
elements.short: (USCDI) Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age
elements.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: abatement[x]
elements.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .effectiveTime.high or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="age at remission"].value or .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ]source[classCode=CONC, moodCode=EVN].status=completed

elements.name: recordedDate
elements.description: The recordedDate represents when this particular Condition record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: recorder
elements.description: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: asserter
elements.description: Individual who is making the condition statement.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: stage
elements.description: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

constraints.human: Stage SHALL have summary or assessment

elements.name: summary
elements.description: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.

binding.description: Codes describing condition stages (e.g. Cancer stages).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: assessment
elements.description: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.description: The kind of staging, such as pathological or clinical staging.

binding.description: Codes describing the kind of condition staging (e.g. clinical or pathological).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: evidence
elements.description: Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition.

constraints.human: evidence SHALL have code or details
